{"step_by_step_thinking": "Histone variant H3.3K27M is indeed associated with gliomas. This mutation occurs in the H3F3A gene, which encodes the histone variant H3.3. The H3.3K27M mutation leads to the substitution of lysine (K) with methionine (M) at position 27 of the H3.3 protein.
